str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To look upon, visit, look out, select.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
Full, abounding in, complete, completely occupied with. From pletho; replete, or covered over; by analogy, complete.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From kata and histemi; to place down, i.e. to designate, constitute, convoy.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
